summary: Do You Believe In Us? (The Flame Pt. 2)
title: Do You Believe In Us? (The Flame Pt. 2)
body:
[Summary]: You knew Tony in college for three years. And in those three years, you had such a crush on him. You’re not really sure if he ever knew, even though there were times when it seemed like he did. And after graduating, you both went your separate ways but you still had those feelings for him. Years later, he reenters your life in the craziest way. And what follows after, gives you so many new experiences in life.

[Pairing]: Tony x reader

Tagging: @captainrogerss @theashhole @dividedwecantfall @peterman-parker @avengerofyourheart @nataliarxmanxva @metalarmproblems @mcuimxgine @accio-rogers @imagine-assembling-the-avengers @that-sokovian-bastard @hellomissmabel @abovethesmokestacks @peculiar-persephone @bellameys @hymnofthevalkyrie @buckys-shield @callamint @redgillan @lancefvcker @thetalesofmooseandsquirrel @iwillbeinmynest @theassetseyeliner @lilasiannerd @aubzylynn @sgtbxckybxrnes @iamwarrenspeace @kamalakahn @marvelrevival @httpmcrvel @avengersnthings @feelmyroarrrr @girl-next-door-writes @redqueen1221 @fandoms-pizza-wifi-ym13 @unoorthoodoox @random-fandom-lady @highonfaeriedust @laurie-ofmoonlightandstardust @greatwerewolfdragon @dlb113

A/N: This series has been inspired by my ‘Love Songs’ playlist on Spotify (x) and real-life events that have happened to me (although a couple things are different. And each part will be based off a song or two from the playlist). This part drew inspiration from these two songs (x) (x)

Pt. 1 |

When you saw Tony in class the next day, you felt a bit scared to ask him about the girl you saw with him. The butterflies in your stomach were going in every direction possible which made it even that much harder to concentrate on what the teacher was saying and the assignment you had to then work on.

So, instead of working on the assignment you wrote out a note to Tony that you were going to hand him when class was over. But as soon as you were finished writing it, you reread it and crumpled it up, thinking it was the stupidest idea you’ve had in years.

“What am I? In high school?” you thought. “I should just be able to face him and talk to him. How is it that I’m scared to do it though?” You folded your arms on the desk and placing your forehead on them you sighed, still not knowing what to do.

The bell rang and you started packing your things, watching Tony out of the corner of your eye. He acted as though there was no problem at all. He noticed you were acting a little distant this morning and went to ask you about it but you quickly grabbed your things and walked out of the classroom.

Going back to your dorm, you laid on the bed. You started thinking about all this flirting the two of you had been doing for the last several months and wondered if any of it was real. If all of it was just a game. If Tony even liked you that way. You grabbed your pillow and screamed into it.

At that point your phone started to ring which made you stop. Looking around for it and not seeing it anywhere on the nightstand or desk, you remembered you threw it in your purse. Fishing around for it and finding it buried underneath everything, you looked at it before the call ended. “Tony ❤️” it read.

You flopped back down on the bed, phone still clutched in your hand. You just didn’t know what to do. It rang again and again it was Tony. Placing the phone on the nightstand, you decided that you were going to stay in your room for the rest of the day. You weren’t sure how you were going to face Tony about this but you know you had too.

Falling asleep, you had several dreams about him and all of them were about you and him being together. From hand holding to just cuddling each other, each dream was different from the next.

You woke up from having your stomach make the loudest noise, realizing you haven’t eaten anything all day and it was somehow already 5 PM. Rubbing your eyes and hearing your stomach once again, you got up and looked in the mirror fixing your hair to make you look somewhat presentable to go to the cafeteria and grab something to eat.

Grabbing your phone, you pressed the button to wake it up and couldn’t believe what your notifs looked like. Eight missed calls and 10 texts from Tony, along with three missed calls from your mom and six texts from her all asking the same thing: “why aren’t you answering?”, “is everything ok?” and “please call!”

As you walked over to the cafeteria, you called your mom and let her know that everything was fine and you just needed some time away from classes cuz you weren’t feeling good. You didn’t think that it would be a good idea to let your mom know that this “feeling” was about a boy because she didn’t exactly approve of you having a boyfriend during school, which never made any sense to you since your sister was able to do that when she was in school and not get yelled at about it. But you brushed the thought out of your mind.

After you got off the phone with her, you hesitated to contact Tony and let him know that you were ok. Bringing up his contact info, your thumb ghosted over the screen while you stared at the name you had for him: Tony ❤️. You quickly closed out of it and swiped the contacts page off. Sighing and almost wanting to cry, you rushed to the cafeteria, grabbed a few things and went back to your dorm.

Sitting on the bed, phone placed in front of you, you spent the next hour and a half debating wether to call him or not. In the end you couldn’t being yourself to do it so you decided that the better thing to do would be to suck it up and face him tomorrow.

You arrived a bit earlier than usual for class that morning, telling yourself over and over that this was just ridiculous and you were stupid for acting the way you were and how could you be such a coward. You also tried repeating a couple things over that you planned on telling him when he showed up. And then it happened.

You saw him enter the room wearing that one t-shirt you like so much on him and all your thoughts went out the door. Your mouth felt like it was now the Sahara Desert and your body felt like it became a two-by-four. Even your face felt flushed and hot.

When he saw you, his eyes immediately widened and went right over to you asking if everything was ok. You nodded, trying to have actual words come out. He could tell that something was going through your mind, so he sat down and gently pulled you down to the seat next to him. He was about to ask you what happened yesterday, while you were about to ask him who the girl was but the teacher walked in to have the class start. Questioning each other would have to wait.

The two of you silently worked through the lecture and when it came time for the class to work on the assignment the teacher gave out, Tony looked over at you and nudged your arm.

“Is everything ok, [Y/N]? I tried calling and texting you last night but you didn’t answer. I was really worried.”

You looked at him and you could see that he really was worried but then wondered if this was all an act. You sucked in a breath and let it out.

“Everything is ok. But I want to know something.”

“What is it?”

You couldn’t believe you were going to say this but you knew that if you didn’t, things would need to change between you two. Yet somehow you also knew that if your thoughts were confirmed on who this other girl was, things would still need to change.

“I like you, Tony. Like a lot. Like, a “more than a friend” type thing. Do you like me that way too? Do you think we could be boyfriend and girlfriend?”

Tony was a little surprised by what you said. But then he looked down, smiled a bit then looked back at you.

“I already have a girlfriend, [Y/N]. I’m sorry. But if you wanted to be my girlfriend, you should’ve said something. I mean, I do like you. I really do. It’s just…”

“But all that flirting we were doing.. don’t you think that should’ve told you I wanted to be with you?”

He sighed. “I’m not very good at reading signs of flirting. I need to have someone tell me that they like me in order for me to want to be with them.”

You really couldn’t believe what he was telling you. He seemed like he was a pro at the flirting game and then says that he’s bad at reading the signs of it. Good gravy, this was all starting to unravel right here in your lap. You turned back to the assignment and started working on it.

“[Y/N]…”

You put up a hand in front of his face and didn’t look at him for the rest of the class. It was hard concentrating but you were doing the best you could. And when the bell rang, you silently and quickly gathered your things and walked out without a word to Tony.

“What am I? In high school?” you thought. “I should just be able to face him and talk to him. How is it that I’m scared to do it though?” You folded your arms on the desk and placing your forehead on them you sighed, still not knowing what to do.

[[MORE]]

The bell rang and you started packing your things, watching Tony out of the corner of your eye. He acted as though there was no problem at all. He noticed you were acting a little distant this morning and went to ask you about it but you quickly grabbed your things and walked out of the classroom.

Going back to your dorm, you laid on the bed. You started thinking about all this flirting the two of you had been doing for the last several months and wondered if any of it was real. If all of it was just a game. If Tony even liked you that way. You grabbed your pillow and screamed into it.

At that point your phone started to ring which made you stop. Looking around for it and not seeing it anywhere on the nightstand or desk, you remembered you threw it in your purse. Fishing around for it and finding it buried underneath everything, you looked at it before the call ended. “Tony ❤️” it read.

You flopped back down on the bed, phone still clutched in your hand. You just didn’t know what to do. It rang again and again it was Tony. Placing the phone on the nightstand, you decided that you were going to stay in your room for the rest of the day. You weren’t sure how you were going to face Tony about this but you know you had too.

Falling asleep, you had several dreams about him and all of them were about you and him being together. From hand holding to just cuddling each other, each dream was different from the next.

You woke up from having your stomach make the loudest noise, realizing you haven’t eaten anything all day and it was somehow already 5 PM. Rubbing your eyes and hearing your stomach once again, you got up and looked in the mirror fixing your hair to make you look somewhat presentable to go to the cafeteria and grab something to eat.

Grabbing your phone, you pressed the button to wake it up and couldn’t believe what your notifs looked like. Eight missed calls and 10 texts from Tony, along with three missed calls from your mom and six texts from her all asking the same thing: “why aren’t you answering?”, “is everything ok?” and “please call!”

As you walked over to the cafeteria, you called your mom and let her know that everything was fine and you just needed some time away from classes cuz you weren’t feeling good. You didn’t think that it would be a good idea to let your mom know that this “feeling” was about a boy because she didn’t exactly approve of you having a boyfriend during school, which never made any sense to you since your sister was able to do that when she was in school and not get yelled at about it. But you brushed the thought out of your mind.

After you got off the phone with her, you hesitated to contact Tony and let him know that you were ok. Bringing up his contact info, your thumb ghosted over the screen while you stared at the name you had for him: Tony ❤️. You quickly closed out of it and swiped the contacts page off. Sighing and almost wanting to cry, you rushed to the cafeteria, grabbed a few things and went back to your dorm.

Sitting on the bed, phone placed in front of you, you spent the next hour and a half debating wether to call him or not. In the end you couldn’t being yourself to do it so you decided that the better thing to do would be to suck it up and face him tomorrow.

You arrived a bit earlier than usual for class that morning, telling yourself over and over that this was just ridiculous and you were stupid for acting the way you were and how could you be such a coward. You also tried repeating a couple things over that you planned on telling him when he showed up. And then it happened.

You saw him enter the room wearing that one t-shirt you like so much on him and all your thoughts went out the door. Your mouth felt like it was now the Sahara Desert and your body felt like it became a two-by-four. Even your face felt flushed and hot.

When he saw you, his eyes immediately widened and went right over to you asking if everything was ok. You nodded, trying to have actual words come out. He could tell that something was going through your mind, so he sat down and gently pulled you down to the seat next to him. He was about to ask you what happened yesterday, while you were about to ask him who the girl was but the teacher walked in to have the class start. Questioning each other would have to wait.

The two of you silently worked through the lecture and when it came time for the class to work on the assignment the teacher gave out, Tony looked over at you and nudged your arm.

“Is everything ok, [Y/N]? I tried calling and texting you last night but you didn’t answer. I was really worried.”

You looked at him and you could see that he really was worried but then wondered if this was all an act. You sucked in a breath and let it out.

“Everything is ok. But I want to know something.”

“What is it?”

You couldn’t believe you were going to say this but you knew that if you didn’t, things would need to change between you two. Yet somehow you also knew that if your thoughts were confirmed on who this other girl was, things would still need to change.

“I like you, Tony. Like a lot. Like, a “more than a friend” type thing. Do you like me that way too? Do you think we could be boyfriend and girlfriend?”

Tony was a little surprised by what you said. But then he looked down, smiled a bit then looked back at you.

“I already have a girlfriend, [Y/N]. I’m sorry. But if you wanted to be my girlfriend, you should’ve said something. I mean, I do like you. I really do. It’s just…”

“But all that flirting we were doing.. don’t you think that should’ve told you I wanted to be with you?”

He sighed. “I’m not very good at reading signs of flirting. I need to have someone tell me that they like me in order for me to want to be with them.”

You really couldn’t believe what he was telling you. He seemed like he was a pro at the flirting game and then says that he’s bad at reading the signs of it. Good gravy, this was all starting to unravel right here in your lap. You turned back to the assignment and started working on it.

“[Y/N]…”

You put up a hand in front of his face and didn’t look at him for the rest of the class. It was hard concentrating but you were doing the best you could. And when the bell rang, you silently and quickly gathered your things and walked out without a word to Tony.

[Summary]: You knew Tony in college for three years. And in those three years, you had such a crush on him. You’re not really sure if he ever knew, even though there were times when it seemed like he did. And after graduating, you both went your separate ways but you still had those feelings for him. Years later, he reenters your life in the craziest way. And what follows after, gives you so many new experiences in life.

summary: Rescue Me (a Tony/Stephen merman au) part 18
title: Rescue Me (a Tony/Stephen merman au) part 18
body:
I know it’s been forever and I wasn’t even sure if I’d be posting any of my fics on tumblr anymore, but several of you have been so sweet and encouraging that I decided to venture out again and, at the very least, try to finish one of my WIPs.

Most of you probably don’t remember where this story ended, so here’s the link to the previous chapter and the chapter 1 masterlist.  Please note, the POV in this chapter shifts between Stephen and Tony, so mind the chapter breaks :)

Tagging:  @ssironstrange @tonystark5ever @sunbean72 @strangemischief @starkstrangequill @mrsstarkstrange @theelvishsociopath @cora-devil @swanheart69 @savedbyholmes @tralfazziod @slytherinironstrange @livgg15 @ennastarkfanfics @le-ephemere @dan-doggo @emmagan @the-gay-gang   @gandalfsoda @whyimnotcreativequestionmark @deathbystarlight @metalandfood @tisfan @ancientmuse @lovekiku @el-rezet @aishus    @larrklopp @fangirl-suri @bananasofthorns @tommyf-ingshelby @mostly-marvel-stuffs @syra-nyth

Part 18

The darkness the Witch had sent him into splintered, exploded suddenly into a disorienting cacophony of flashing, whirling lights.  He staggered under the intensity of them, bringing his hand up to shield his eyes from the blinding flares.  And froze as a deafening roar filled his ears.

The space before him buckled, twisted and warped, rippling into a giant horned head with glowing purple eyes that burned with murderous fury.  The black gaping void of a mouth opened, the booming voice rumbling forth, sending shockwaves through the air around him.

“How dare you intrude upon my rest!” it growled, a wave of hot foul breath slamming into Stephen, nearly knocking him down.  “Leave at once!”

“No,” he shook his head, curling his trembling hands into fists at his sides.  “I’ve come to ask you for your amulet, Dormammu, and I won’t leave until I get it.”

The head warped and rippled, purple eyes blazing with indignation.  “The only thing you’ll get from me is your death!”  

The words have not yet finished ringing through the air as three long spikes rose up sharply from the ground underneath Stephen’s feet, tearing through his body, spearing him cruelly in place – a swift and brutal retribution for his reckless audacity.

***

The first wave of pain took him by surprise – a series of vicious, breath-robbing stabs that seemed to go straight through the center of his arc reactor, folding him in half and dropping him to his knees.

It was over as quickly as it had begun, and he knelt there in wide-eyed misery, his free hand pressed firmly against his chest as he tried unsuccessfully to suck in a long, steady breath.  He felt a tingle in his other hand, and he glanced down at the amulet, frowning in apprehension as he watched the green light emitted by the jewel at its center flicker once and then again, even as the jewel itself grew suddenly, uncomfortably hot.  Then, just as abruptly, the heat dissipated, and the light returned to its steady rich glow.

“What…,” he gasped out, looking up at the Witch, “what happened? What does this mean?”

She met his searching gaze calmly, a shrug of almost callous indifference tugging at her shoulders. “He was killed,” she supplied, adding before Tony’s horror-stunned mind could even formulate a response, “And then he was revived.  Just as I knew he would be.”  She nodded at the amulet in Tony’s hand, “He’s safe as long as you keep this on you.”

He blinked, absently rubbing his still aching chest.  “Safe? You call this safe?”  

The Witch shrugged again. “He’ll be revived every time.”

“And how many times is that gonna be, huh?” he challenged, suddenly angry.  “How many times is he going to have to die for him to–”

“Until Dormammu grows weary of repetition and gives him what he asked for.”  The Witch’s gaze narrowed, unsympathetic.  “It’s the only way for him to save you, human.  All you have to do is keep your fist closed.”

He reared back, bristling at her insinuation.  Gripped the amulet harder, opening his mouth to snap back a snarky retort.  But just then another wave of pain hit, ripping through his body, tearing it apart piece by piece, and whatever he was about to say became lost in a hoarse moan of a scream.

***

It surprised him each time when he reappeared on Dormammu’s plane alive and whole, every grotesque agonizing death – nothing but a vivid memory.  It comforted him, too.  Because it meant that Tony was still there, still holding on.  It gave him hope.

“It’s of no use,” he rasped, his legs shaky as he stood tall once more to Dormammu’s outraged roar. “I’m stuck here with you until you give me what I want.”

“Leave. Me. ALONE!!!”

The earth around him shook and shuddered, his clothes whipped about violently by the gale-like gust of a breath.  “No,” he refused the moment he could pull air back into his lungs.  “Not until you give me what I want.”

“How long do you think you can keep this up?” the creature taunted, towering over Stephen’s form. “How much more pain can you endure?”

He smiled at that – a crooked, sad little thing that pulled at the corners of his lips, more a grimace than anything else.  “Pain’s an old friend,” he murmured, defiant, and squared his shoulders in preparation for more.

***

He must have passed out at one point, because he suddenly found himself flat on his back on the cold cave floor with no memory of how he got there.  There was something cold clasped around his right hand, an odd pressure pushing down on his fingers, forcing them to curl inward around some hard oval shape that was cutting into the flesh of his palm.

He shifted, turning his head toward it, and barely restrained a yelp of distress upon seeing the Witch crouched there next to his outstretched arm, mere inches away.

“What?” he blurted out, foregoing all thought of eloquence as he struggled to bring his heart back to a less panicked rhythm.

“You fainted,” the Witch explained dryly, her expression one of open accusation.  “You dropped the amulet.”

His heart jolted in panic – a painful jab against his ribs.  

“Stephen?”

He fought to twist his arm out of the Witch’s grasp, to look at the amulet.  He needed to see it, needed to know if he had failed, if Stephen was…

“You got lucky.”  The Witch released his hand, and he yanked it toward him, turning it shakily palm up to see for himself.  “The amulet fell close enough to you that I was able to use your own hand to reach it.”

At his confused glance she clarified, “The spell relies on the connection between the two of you.  If anyone else, including me, picks up the amulet, that connection will be severed.”

He nodded numbly, digesting her words.  Pulled himself laboriously into a sitting position.  

“So he’s okay?”  The jewel glowed a steady, reassuring green in the cup of his hand, still he wanted, needed to be sure.

“He’s okay,” the Witch confirmed.  “You did not have it away from you for long.  Like I said…”

“…lucky,” he finished for her, his voice dull with a sobering realization.  He was getting weaker, and he knew it.  His body, already severely taxed by the poison leaking from the reactor’s palladium core, was slowly but surely giving up.  He didn’t know how much longer he could endure before it failed him altogether.  And then he wouldn’t be able to hold on to the amulet, and Stephen would…

“You won’t last much longer,” the Witch observed – a ruthless echo of his own thoughts.  “And you may not get so lucky next time.”

He nodded again, his brain churning as he desperately tried to think of something, anything to fix this.  His gaze landed on the rumpled, oil-stained sleeve of his Henley, and suddenly the solution appeared before him as clear as day, simple, so ridiculously simple – it almost made him laugh out loud.  Almost.

He reached up toward the open vee of his shirt’s placket, gripped both sides as well as he could without relinquishing his hold on the amulet, and yanked.  Hard.  The fabric crackled as it ripped, the material having been rent violently in two, and he shrugged quickly out of the left sleeve, letting the ripped remains of his shirt slide down his right arm to pool at his fisted hand.  

“H-help me,” he stammered out, struggling to wrap the material around his right fist one-handed, his muscles trembling from weakness and the cold air of the cave that nipped against his now bare skin.  “I need you to… t-tie it.  ‘s tight as you c-can.”

The Witch eyed him intently, something odd flickering in her expression.  Then, wordlessly, she shifted closer, took the greased fabric from his shaking fingers.  “This is the second time you’ve surprised me, human,” she admitted as she began wrapping the fabric tightly around his closed hand, something close to admiration in her quietly contemplative voice.  “I did not think it possible.”

He shrugged, wincing when she tied off the ends a little too roughly.  “Thanks…. I guess.”  

And then he didn’t say anything more.  Because that was when another wave of pain hit.  And then another.  And then another.  

He swayed in place, gasping harshly as an invisible blade sliced through him again and again and again.  Careened to the side, collapsing feebly back onto the floor, his cheek pressing hard into the cold, unforgiving stone.  

More pain ripped through him, spiking outwards from his arc reactor, and he gurgled breathlessly as something hot and viscous poured up his throat, spilling into his mouth, dribbling past his cracked lips.  His chest twitched weakly in a useless attempt to draw air into his starving lungs, his vision graying from lack of oxygen and constant, unbearable pain.  But even as his eyelids fluttered to a close, their descent slow and inevitable, echoing the faint halting beat of his dying heart, he smiled.  Because he could still see the blurry outlines of his wrapped hand lying on the floor in front of him.  Could still feel the pressure of the amulet against the inside of his palm and the occasional searing heat that spoke of Stephen’s continuous revival.  Because Stephen would be okay….

Part 18

The darkness the Witch had sent him into splintered, exploded suddenly into a disorienting cacophony of flashing, whirling lights.  He staggered under the intensity of them, bringing his hand up to shield his eyes from the blinding flares.  And froze as a deafening roar filled his ears.

The space before him buckled, twisted and warped, rippling into a giant horned head with glowing purple eyes that burned with murderous fury.  The black gaping void of a mouth opened, the booming voice rumbling forth, sending shockwaves through the air around him.

“How dare you intrude upon my rest!” it growled, a wave of hot foul breath slamming into Stephen, nearly knocking him down.  “Leave at once!”

“No,” he shook his head, curling his trembling hands into fists at his sides.  “I’ve come to ask you for your amulet, Dormammu, and I won’t leave until I get it.”

The head warped and rippled, purple eyes blazing with indignation.  “The only thing you’ll get from me is your death!”  

The words have not yet finished ringing through the air as three long spikes rose up sharply from the ground underneath Stephen’s feet, tearing through his body, spearing him cruelly in place – a swift and brutal retribution for his reckless audacity.

Part 18

The darkness the Witch had sent him into splintered, exploded suddenly into a disorienting cacophony of flashing, whirling lights.  He staggered under the intensity of them, bringing his hand up to shield his eyes from the blinding flares.  And froze as a deafening roar filled his ears.

The head warped and rippled, purple eyes blazing with indignation.  “The only thing you’ll get from me is your death!”  

The words have not yet finished ringing through the air as three long spikes rose up sharply from the ground underneath Stephen’s feet, tearing through his body, spearing him cruelly in place – a swift and brutal retribution for his reckless audacity.

[[MORE]]

***

The first wave of pain took him by surprise – a series of vicious, breath-robbing stabs that seemed to go straight through the center of his arc reactor, folding him in half and dropping him to his knees.

It was over as quickly as it had begun, and he knelt there in wide-eyed misery, his free hand pressed firmly against his chest as he tried unsuccessfully to suck in a long, steady breath.  He felt a tingle in his other hand, and he glanced down at the amulet, frowning in apprehension as he watched the green light emitted by the jewel at its center flicker once and then again, even as the jewel itself grew suddenly, uncomfortably hot.  Then, just as abruptly, the heat dissipated, and the light returned to its steady rich glow.

“What…,” he gasped out, looking up at the Witch, “what happened? What does this mean?”

She met his searching gaze calmly, a shrug of almost callous indifference tugging at her shoulders. “He was killed,” she supplied, adding before Tony’s horror-stunned mind could even formulate a response, “And then he was revived.  Just as I knew he would be.”  She nodded at the amulet in Tony’s hand, “He’s safe as long as you keep this on you.”

He blinked, absently rubbing his still aching chest.  “Safe? You call this safe?”  

The Witch shrugged again. “He’ll be revived every time.”

“And how many times is that gonna be, huh?” he challenged, suddenly angry.  “How many times is he going to have to die for him to–”

“Until Dormammu grows weary of repetition and gives him what he asked for.”  The Witch’s gaze narrowed, unsympathetic.  “It’s the only way for him to save you, human.  All you have to do is keep your fist closed.”

He reared back, bristling at her insinuation.  Gripped the amulet harder, opening his mouth to snap back a snarky retort.  But just then another wave of pain hit, ripping through his body, tearing it apart piece by piece, and whatever he was about to say became lost in a hoarse moan of a scream.

***

It surprised him each time when he reappeared on Dormammu’s plane alive and whole, every grotesque agonizing death – nothing but a vivid memory.  It comforted him, too.  Because it meant that Tony was still there, still holding on.  It gave him hope.

“It’s of no use,” he rasped, his legs shaky as he stood tall once more to Dormammu’s outraged roar. “I’m stuck here with you until you give me what I want.”

“Leave. Me. ALONE!!!”

The earth around him shook and shuddered, his clothes whipped about violently by the gale-like gust of a breath.  “No,” he refused the moment he could pull air back into his lungs.  “Not until you give me what I want.”

“How long do you think you can keep this up?” the creature taunted, towering over Stephen’s form. “How much more pain can you endure?”

He smiled at that – a crooked, sad little thing that pulled at the corners of his lips, more a grimace than anything else.  “Pain’s an old friend,” he murmured, defiant, and squared his shoulders in preparation for more.

***

He must have passed out at one point, because he suddenly found himself flat on his back on the cold cave floor with no memory of how he got there.  There was something cold clasped around his right hand, an odd pressure pushing down on his fingers, forcing them to curl inward around some hard oval shape that was cutting into the flesh of his palm.

He shifted, turning his head toward it, and barely restrained a yelp of distress upon seeing the Witch crouched there next to his outstretched arm, mere inches away.

“What?” he blurted out, foregoing all thought of eloquence as he struggled to bring his heart back to a less panicked rhythm.

“You fainted,” the Witch explained dryly, her expression one of open accusation.  “You dropped the amulet.”

His heart jolted in panic – a painful jab against his ribs.  

“Stephen?”

He fought to twist his arm out of the Witch’s grasp, to look at the amulet.  He needed to see it, needed to know if he had failed, if Stephen was…

“You got lucky.”  The Witch released his hand, and he yanked it toward him, turning it shakily palm up to see for himself.  “The amulet fell close enough to you that I was able to use your own hand to reach it.”

At his confused glance she clarified, “The spell relies on the connection between the two of you.  If anyone else, including me, picks up the amulet, that connection will be severed.”

He nodded numbly, digesting her words.  Pulled himself laboriously into a sitting position.  

“So he’s okay?”  The jewel glowed a steady, reassuring green in the cup of his hand, still he wanted, needed to be sure.

“He’s okay,” the Witch confirmed.  “You did not have it away from you for long.  Like I said…”

“…lucky,” he finished for her, his voice dull with a sobering realization.  He was getting weaker, and he knew it.  His body, already severely taxed by the poison leaking from the reactor’s palladium core, was slowly but surely giving up.  He didn’t know how much longer he could endure before it failed him altogether.  And then he wouldn’t be able to hold on to the amulet, and Stephen would…

“You won’t last much longer,” the Witch observed – a ruthless echo of his own thoughts.  “And you may not get so lucky next time.”

He nodded again, his brain churning as he desperately tried to think of something, anything to fix this.  His gaze landed on the rumpled, oil-stained sleeve of his Henley, and suddenly the solution appeared before him as clear as day, simple, so ridiculously simple – it almost made him laugh out loud.  Almost.

He reached up toward the open vee of his shirt’s placket, gripped both sides as well as he could without relinquishing his hold on the amulet, and yanked.  Hard.  The fabric crackled as it ripped, the material having been rent violently in two, and he shrugged quickly out of the left sleeve, letting the ripped remains of his shirt slide down his right arm to pool at his fisted hand.  

“H-help me,” he stammered out, struggling to wrap the material around his right fist one-handed, his muscles trembling from weakness and the cold air of the cave that nipped against his now bare skin.  “I need you to… t-tie it.  ‘s tight as you c-can.”

The Witch eyed him intently, something odd flickering in her expression.  Then, wordlessly, she shifted closer, took the greased fabric from his shaking fingers.  “This is the second time you’ve surprised me, human,” she admitted as she began wrapping the fabric tightly around his closed hand, something close to admiration in her quietly contemplative voice.  “I did not think it possible.”

He shrugged, wincing when she tied off the ends a little too roughly.  “Thanks…. I guess.”  

And then he didn’t say anything more.  Because that was when another wave of pain hit.  And then another.  And then another.  

He swayed in place, gasping harshly as an invisible blade sliced through him again and again and again.  Careened to the side, collapsing feebly back onto the floor, his cheek pressing hard into the cold, unforgiving stone.  

More pain ripped through him, spiking outwards from his arc reactor, and he gurgled breathlessly as something hot and viscous poured up his throat, spilling into his mouth, dribbling past his cracked lips.  His chest twitched weakly in a useless attempt to draw air into his starving lungs, his vision graying from lack of oxygen and constant, unbearable pain.  But even as his eyelids fluttered to a close, their descent slow and inevitable, echoing the faint halting beat of his dying heart, he smiled.  Because he could still see the blurry outlines of his wrapped hand lying on the floor in front of him.  Could still feel the pressure of the amulet against the inside of his palm and the occasional searing heat that spoke of Stephen’s continuous revival.  Because Stephen would be okay….

The Witch eyed him intently, something odd flickering in her expression.  Then, wordlessly, she shifted closer, took the greased fabric from his shaking fingers.  “This is the second time you’ve surprised me, human,” she admitted as she began wrapping the fabric tightly around his closed hand, something close to admiration in her quietly contemplative voice.  “I did not think it possible.”

He shrugged, wincing when she tied off the ends a little too roughly.  “Thanks…. I guess.”  

And then he didn’t say anything more.  Because that was when another wave of pain hit.  And then another.  And then another.  

He swayed in place, gasping harshly as an invisible blade sliced through him again and again and again.  Careened to the side, collapsing feebly back onto the floor, his cheek pressing hard into the cold, unforgiving stone.  

More pain ripped through him, spiking outwards from his arc reactor, and he gurgled breathlessly as something hot and viscous poured up his throat, spilling into his mouth, dribbling past his cracked lips.  His chest twitched weakly in a useless attempt to draw air into his starving lungs, his vision graying from lack of oxygen and constant, unbearable pain.  But even as his eyelids fluttered to a close, their descent slow and inevitable, echoing the faint halting beat of his dying heart, he smiled.  Because he could still see the blurry outlines of his wrapped hand lying on the floor in front of him.  Could still feel the pressure of the amulet against the inside of his palm and the occasional searing heat that spoke of Stephen’s continuous revival.  Because Stephen would be okay….
trail.content_abstract:
I know it’s been forever and I wasn’t even sure if I’d be posting any of my fics on tumblr anymore, but several of you have been so sweet and encouraging that I decided to venture out again and, at the very least, try to finish one of my WIPs.

Most of you probably don’t remember where this story ended, so here’s the link to the previous chapter and the chapter 1 masterlist.  Please note, the POV in this chapter shifts between Stephen and Tony, so mind the chapter breaks :)

Tagging:  @ssironstrange @tonystark5ever @sunbean72 @strangemischief @starkstrangequill @mrsstarkstrange @theelvishsociopath @cora-devil @swanheart69 @savedbyholmes @tralfazziod @slytherinironstrange @livgg15 @ennastarkfanfics @le-ephemere @dan-doggo @emmagan @the-gay-gang   @gandalfsoda @whyimnotcreativequestionmark @deathbystarlight @metalandfood @tisfan @ancientmuse @lovekiku @el-rezet @aishus    @larrklopp @fangirl-suri @bananasofthorns @tommyf-ingshelby @mostly-marvel-stuffs @syra-nyth

Part 18

The darkness the Witch had sent him into splintered, exploded suddenly into a disorienting cacophony of flashing, whirling lights.  He staggered under the intensity of them, bringing his hand up to shield his eyes from the blinding flares.  And froze as a deafening roar filled his ears.

The space before him buckled, twisted and warped, rippling into a giant horned head with glowing purple eyes that burned with murderous fury.  The black gaping void of a mouth opened, the booming voice rumbling forth, sending shockwaves through the air around him.

“How dare you intrude upon my rest!” it growled, a wave of hot foul breath slamming into Stephen, nearly knocking him down.  “Leave at once!”

“No,” he shook his head, curling his trembling hands into fists at his sides.  “I’ve come to ask you for your amulet, Dormammu, and I won’t leave until I get it.”

The head warped and rippled, purple eyes blazing with indignation.  “The only thing you’ll get from me is your death!”  

The words have not yet finished ringing through the air as three long spikes rose up sharply from the ground underneath Stephen’s feet, tearing through his body, spearing him cruelly in place – a swift and brutal retribution for his reckless audacity.

title: Suit
body:
(Peter when he doesn’t see you in the lab)

Masterlist

Summary: You are working on one of your father’s suits, something goes wrong and the suit flies up and into the sky with you tagging along.

Warnings: Nothing really

 A/N: Something that I saw and wanted to make into an imagine. here you go my little munchkins :) 

You were in the lab with Peter working on your dad’s suit. Peter sits on the other side of the room on the table, keeping you company. In his lap, he has a bowl of popcorn because all he does is eat. You pick up a few tools and tweak and enhance parts of the iron suit. You hear the lab doors open with a hiss and turn to see your dad walking up towards a suit that you’re not working on.

“Hey, dad. Where you off to?” You ask while your attention is still on the metal suit in front of you.

“Just a quick mission, nothing major. Won’t be long and thank you for enhancing my suit, you are indeed my daughter.” He says with a smile while pointing at the suit that is half deconstructed.

You smile up at your father with love and adoration. You see him get into his suit, Peter still watching in amazement even though he has seen it many times before. Tony walks off the platform his suit was on and walks towards you. His mask unfolds to reveal his face. He plants a soft kiss on your forehead before saying.

“Bye, kid. Don’t stay up too late.” He says before turning around and giving Peter a high five. The roof opens and your dad shoots into the sky, saving the day. You leave the roof open to look at the stars and to let a breeze in.

You wish to be like your dad, brave, selfless, strong. You wish to be an Avenger, but your dad told you that you can when you make your own suit. You’re broken out of your thoughts by Peter’s voice.

“I’m going to get more popcorn, babe.” He says before exiting the lab to get more snacks. You focus your attention on the suit in front of you. You pick up the screwdriver and tighten the new board that you’ve made. Little did you know that it activated. You turn around, with your back towards the suit to pick up another tool when suddenly a metal hand clamps down on your wrist and shoots up into the sky. Leaving you dangling with no protection.

A scream leaves your lips, the cold air piercing your skin and the adrenaline rushing through your veins. You look down, bad choice, to see the ground get smaller and smaller. Your body fills with panic and dread, you prepare yourself for death, thinking about your loved ones, Tony, Steve, Natasha, Bucky even though you’re supposed to hate him you see him as your big, brainwashed, brother. You think of Peter, your boyfriend, someone you love so dearly and unconditionally.

You feel tears stream down your cheeks but turn to ice at the temperature drop from so high up. All you can do is hang there. The hand still gripping your wrist painfully tight. Suddenly the hand lets go and you panic, you grab onto the foot of the suit. Your heart almost coming out your throat. You have a small sense of relief but are still panicked because you have no idea how you’re going to make out of this alive.

Your thoughts are broken by a voice telling you to let go, you hear it come from the suit and recognise it as your dad’s, without hesitation you let go and you feel yourself falling to your death. Your stomach in your through and the feeling of air slipping through your limbs as you flail around, wondering why your dad told you to let go.

You look around the empty sky to try and find your dad, you see him shooting towards you, his hand reaches out to you to try and grab you but misses and you’re still falling to your death. You hear him scream “No!” but it’s too late, there is no way that he can get to you in time, but he still tries, not letting the thought of you dying get to him. You accept the fact that you’re going to die, seeing the buildings getting bigger and bigger as you near the earth’s surface.

Suddenly you feel a wet sticky substance on your hands. You’re suddenly jerked to a stop. You feel your arm being yanked out if it’s socket, but you don’t feel anything due to the fear and panic coursing through you. You see a red and blue suit slowly pulling you up by the web stuck to you. The realisation of who it is makes you burst into hysterics. The tears roll down your face at the sight of your boyfriend, thinking that you wouldn’t be able to see him again.

“Shh, it’s okay, I’ve got you. You’re safe now.” His soothing voice making way to your ears, calming you slightly. Peter eventually pulls you all the way up and you fall in his arms, your body cold and shaking. You bury your head on his neck, savouring the time you have on the solid ground. Peter’s arms wrap around you, holding you close to him, reassuring you that you’re okay. He moves his arms and one presses against your dislocated shoulder. You wince, and Peter slowly pulls back, inspecting you. He sees your misaligned shoulder and his eyes soften at your pain. He fills up with guilty because he knows that was what happened when he stopped you with his web.

“I’m so sorry, this is all my fault.” He apologizes.

“I would rather have a dislocated shoulder than be dead so.” You say, drying your eyes with the non-injured hand.

You feel the building top shake lightly, you see that your dad has landed and is making his way out of his suit. He rushes towards you with worry etched on his face. You run towards him, tears brimming your eyes and his. He wraps his arms around you and holds you tight, you feel the pain in your shoulder but ignore it, embracing your dad as best as you can.

“I almost lost you.” He whispers in your hair, tears streaming down his face. Stroking your hair and kissing your head every now and then. You hold him close to you, relishing in the warmth of his body and the sent that you will always remind you of him. Tony slowly pulls away and looks at Peter, he walks towards him, Peter looking a little scared, having no idea what is about to happen. Before Peter could comprehend your dad tackles him in a bone crushing hug.

“Thank you so much for saving her.” He says in his ear. You see Peter’s arms wrap around your dad. You break the hug short because the pain in your shoulder is becoming unbearable.

“Uh, sorry to cut this short but I need to get this shoulder sorted out.”

Your dad breaks away and looks at you confused. He looks to your shoulder and sees it not where it should be.

“What happened?” he says shocked.

“When Peter caught me my stopped suddenly so my shoulder got dislocated.” You explain calmly. You see Peter tense, wondering if your dad was going to come at him for hurting you.

“Well, I would rather you have a dislocated shoulder than be dead.” He says, you see Peter relax slightly.

Like father light daughter.

Your dad breaks away and looks at you confused. He looks to your shoulder and sees it not where it should be.

“What happened?” he says shocked.

“When Peter caught me my stopped suddenly so my shoulder got dislocated.” You explain calmly. You see Peter tense, wondering if your dad was going to come at him for hurting you.

“Well, I would rather you have a dislocated shoulder than be dead.” He says, you see Peter relax slightly.

Like father light daughter.

trail.content_raw:
(Peter when he doesn’t see you in the lab)

Masterlist

Summary: You are working on one of your father’s suits, something goes wrong and the suit flies up and into the sky with you tagging along.

Warnings: Nothing really

 A/N: Something that I saw and wanted to make into an imagine. here you go my little munchkins :) 

You were in the lab with Peter working on your dad’s suit. Peter sits on the other side of the room on the table, keeping you company. In his lap, he has a bowl of popcorn because all he does is eat. You pick up a few tools and tweak and enhance parts of the iron suit. You hear the lab doors open with a hiss and turn to see your dad walking up towards a suit that you’re not working on.

“Hey, dad. Where you off to?” You ask while your attention is still on the metal suit in front of you.

“Just a quick mission, nothing major. Won’t be long and thank you for enhancing my suit, you are indeed my daughter.” He says with a smile while pointing at the suit that is half deconstructed.

You smile up at your father with love and adoration. You see him get into his suit, Peter still watching in amazement even though he has seen it many times before. Tony walks off the platform his suit was on and walks towards you. His mask unfolds to reveal his face. He plants a soft kiss on your forehead before saying.

“Bye, kid. Don’t stay up too late.” He says before turning around and giving Peter a high five. The roof opens and your dad shoots into the sky, saving the day. You leave the roof open to look at the stars and to let a breeze in.

You wish to be like your dad, brave, selfless, strong. You wish to be an Avenger, but your dad told you that you can when you make your own suit. You’re broken out of your thoughts by Peter’s voice.

“I’m going to get more popcorn, babe.” He says before exiting the lab to get more snacks. You focus your attention on the suit in front of you. You pick up the screwdriver and tighten the new board that you’ve made. Little did you know that it activated. You turn around, with your back towards the suit to pick up another tool when suddenly a metal hand clamps down on your wrist and shoots up into the sky. Leaving you dangling with no protection.

A scream leaves your lips, the cold air piercing your skin and the adrenaline rushing through your veins. You look down, bad choice, to see the ground get smaller and smaller. Your body fills with panic and dread, you prepare yourself for death, thinking about your loved ones, Tony, Steve, Natasha, Bucky even though you’re supposed to hate him you see him as your big, brainwashed, brother. You think of Peter, your boyfriend, someone you love so dearly and unconditionally.

You feel tears stream down your cheeks but turn to ice at the temperature drop from so high up. All you can do is hang there. The hand still gripping your wrist painfully tight. Suddenly the hand lets go and you panic, you grab onto the foot of the suit. Your heart almost coming out your throat. You have a small sense of relief but are still panicked because you have no idea how you’re going to make out of this alive.

Your thoughts are broken by a voice telling you to let go, you hear it come from the suit and recognise it as your dad’s, without hesitation you let go and you feel yourself falling to your death. Your stomach in your through and the feeling of air slipping through your limbs as you flail around, wondering why your dad told you to let go.

You look around the empty sky to try and find your dad, you see him shooting towards you, his hand reaches out to you to try and grab you but misses and you’re still falling to your death. You hear him scream “No!” but it’s too late, there is no way that he can get to you in time, but he still tries, not letting the thought of you dying get to him. You accept the fact that you’re going to die, seeing the buildings getting bigger and bigger as you near the earth’s surface.

Suddenly you feel a wet sticky substance on your hands. You’re suddenly jerked to a stop. You feel your arm being yanked out if it’s socket, but you don’t feel anything due to the fear and panic coursing through you. You see a red and blue suit slowly pulling you up by the web stuck to you. The realisation of who it is makes you burst into hysterics. The tears roll down your face at the sight of your boyfriend, thinking that you wouldn’t be able to see him again.

“Shh, it’s okay, I’ve got you. You’re safe now.” His soothing voice making way to your ears, calming you slightly. Peter eventually pulls you all the way up and you fall in his arms, your body cold and shaking. You bury your head on his neck, savouring the time you have on the solid ground. Peter’s arms wrap around you, holding you close to him, reassuring you that you’re okay. He moves his arms and one presses against your dislocated shoulder. You wince, and Peter slowly pulls back, inspecting you. He sees your misaligned shoulder and his eyes soften at your pain. He fills up with guilty because he knows that was what happened when he stopped you with his web.

“I’m so sorry, this is all my fault.” He apologizes.

“I would rather have a dislocated shoulder than be dead so.” You say, drying your eyes with the non-injured hand.

You feel the building top shake lightly, you see that your dad has landed and is making his way out of his suit. He rushes towards you with worry etched on his face. You run towards him, tears brimming your eyes and his. He wraps his arms around you and holds you tight, you feel the pain in your shoulder but ignore it, embracing your dad as best as you can.

“I almost lost you.” He whispers in your hair, tears streaming down his face. Stroking your hair and kissing your head every now and then. You hold him close to you, relishing in the warmth of his body and the sent that you will always remind you of him. Tony slowly pulls away and looks at Peter, he walks towards him, Peter looking a little scared, having no idea what is about to happen. Before Peter could comprehend your dad tackles him in a bone crushing hug.

“Thank you so much for saving her.” He says in his ear. You see Peter’s arms wrap around your dad. You break the hug short because the pain in your shoulder is becoming unbearable.

“Uh, sorry to cut this short but I need to get this shoulder sorted out.”

Your dad breaks away and looks at you confused. He looks to your shoulder and sees it not where it should be.

“What happened?” he says shocked.

“When Peter caught me my stopped suddenly so my shoulder got dislocated.” You explain calmly. You see Peter tense, wondering if your dad was going to come at him for hurting you.

“Well, I would rather you have a dislocated shoulder than be dead.” He says, you see Peter relax slightly.

Like father light daughter.

title: The Driving Thing
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2FBf45t

by Rainsaber

Driving is serious business. So serious that Peter’s first experience on Homecoming night left him with a little bit of anxiety. Scratch that, a whole LOT of anxiety. And ignoring the problem only gets Peter as far as his eighteenth birthday where Tony is concerned. The bigger issue though is what happens to Peter when something happens to Tony. Sequel to The College Thing.

Series: Part 2 of The Non-Superhero Stuff
